publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Pancharis : the first booke. Containing the preparation of the loue betweene Ovven Tudyr, and the Queene, long since intended to her maiden Maiestie: and now dedicated to the inuincible Iames, second and greater Monarch of great Britaine, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, with the islands adiacent
monogr.author: Holland, Hugh

div.head: E: B: Anacreontickes.
div.l: SCarse 'till now hath ENGLAND seen
A Poëm, but of verses store;
Here an vnenforced green
Hath natiue flowres, which heretofore
Had, at most, well painted been,
As was the season which them bore:
Arts each Venus that doth shine
In antient Poësie, heer more.
HOLLAND, this first birth of thine
Put forth imperfect, stands before
The finished, and shall in fine
Somewhat be new for worlds t'adore:
CYNTHIVS (as we diuine)
And the MVSES, and the GRACES,
And their QVEENE, by thee refine
Bastard Songs, whose common bases
Were but words, that KATHARINE
Beautie ęquall to her faces
Might enioy Here then vnhard
A Princely Love, and learned Bard.
